title: Rise Of The Dinosaurs
description: Dinosaurs ruled the earth for many millions of years, but only after a mass extinction took out most of their rivals. Just how that happened remains a mystery — sounds like a case for paleoclimatologist Celina Suarez! Suarez walks us through her scientific detective work, with a little help from her trusty sidekick, scientist-in-residence Regina G. Barber.

itunes:title: Rise Of The Dinosaurs
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Dinosaurs emerged from the Late Triassic Extinction event as the dominant land organisms. But what exactly wiped out their rival creatures remains a mystery.
itunes:subtitle: Dinosaurs emerged from the Late Triassic Extinction event as the dominant land organisms. But what exactly wiped out their rival creatures remains a mystery.
